results.title: Beyond silence
results.creator_credit: Milner-Fenwick, United States Information Service and Edmond Levy
results.brief_description: The story of Gallaudet College in Washington D.C., where the deaf are trained to prepare themselves for the hearing world. Follows a new student from class to class and shows how the deaf are simultaneously taught lip-reading and sign language in the course of enrollment in a regular four year college curriculum leading to a Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree. Explains that hearing students from other countries receive instruction at the Gallaudet Graduate School in the art of teaching the deaf.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milner-Fenwick, United States Information Service and Edmond Levy

results.title: Beyond gravity
results.creator_credit: James H. Wallace, James Wallace Productions and Garth Maxwell
results.brief_description: Richard spends his time fantasising about outerspace and the cosmos, an activity which antagonises friends and family. Then one day he meets Johnny, a handsome Italian man, with an enormous appetite for life, who offers him love and an escape from the monotony of work. This short New Zealand film is a joyous celebration of the love between two eccentrics. It is also a refreshingly matter-of-fact and comic treatment of a romance between two men who both have their sights aimed firmly amongst the stars.

results.title: Beyond cubism
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at some of the sculpture of this century, including the works, philosophies and sources of inspiration of such artists as Marcel Duchamp, Man Ray, Joan Miro, Alexander Calder, Alberto Glacommetti, Barbara Hepworth and Anthony Caro.

results.title: Beware the friendly dragon
results.brief_description: Animated educational film to teach young children about thedangers of playing around railway tracks. “The friendly dragon” is an allusion to trains.

results.title: Between wars
results.brief_description: In 1918, Edward Trenbow, a young Australian doctor serving in World War I is assigned to a mental hospital and befriends a German prisoner-of-war, Dr Karl Schneider. From him he learns of the controversial theories of Sigmund Freud but loses interest when moved to a Sydney mental hospital. Stars Corin Redgrave, Arthur Dignam and Judy Morris.

results.title: Between two rivers
results.brief_description: Oxford, Stratford-upon-Avon and the Cotswolds form the backcloth of this travelogue. After exploring the history of the university city of Oxford, the film moves to Stratford-upon-Avon where sequences include an excerpt from a production of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” at the Royal Shakespeare Theatre, and a visit to Anne Hathaway’s cottage. Music composed and conducted by Muir Mathieson.

results.title: Between the wars. - 4.
results.creator_credit: William T. Cartwright, Anthony Potter Productions and REG
results.brief_description: The first of this two-part analysis of Roosevelt and Hitler, “Their rise to power” contrasts the careers and styles of the two men to show how individual leadership can influence history. The careers of both men culminated in 1933 when Hitler achieved total control of Germany through propaganda and terrorism and Roosevelt introduced The New Deal. “The Dynamics of power” contrasts their use of the media to further their aims, Roosevelt through his radio fireside chats, and Hitler, ie. Goebbels, through the brilliant use of Leni Riefenstahl’s films and newsreels, culminating in the Berlin Olympics.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William T. Cartwright, Anthony Potter Productions and REG

results.title: Between the wars. - 1.
results.creator_credit: Anthony Potter, Anthony Potter Productions and Reeves Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: In these first two programs we follow President Woodrow Wilson’s struggles to involve the United States in the League of Nations. His passionate idealism made him unable to compromise, leading to the harsh conditions imposed upon Germany in the Treaty of Versailles, and his defeat in the United States Senate by those who did not wish to involve America in foreign affairs. Narrated by Eric Sevareid.

results.title: Between the tides
results.creator_credit: Ian Ferguson, British Transport Films and Ralph Keene
results.brief_description: Reveals some of the animal and plant life not always visible to the naked eye, and shows the fascinating creatures which can be found in rock pools and shallow waters among the breeding grounds of Britain’s sea-birds. The film brings to light a wealth of pictorial information in the best traditions of the nature documentary film and was awarded prizes at a number of international film festivals between 1958 and 1960.
